content.question:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 column table with 3 rows of data. The data in the table are as follows. Row 1. f of 3, equals 3, and the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x, equals 2. Row 2. g of 3, equals 8, and the limit as x approaches 3, of, g of x, equals 8. Row 3. h of 3, equals 4, and the limit as x approaches 3, of, h of x, equals 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left" columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>g</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>h</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
The table above gives selected values and limits of the functions <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, open parenthesis, h of x, times, open parenthesis, 2 times f of x, plus, 3 times g of x, close parenthesis, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 1.5: Determining Limits Using Algebraic Properties of Limits

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
